line.text: Since I left you mine eye is in my mind
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And that which governs me to go about
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Doth part his function and is partly blind
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Seems seeing but effectually is out
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: For it no form delivers to the heart
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Of bird of flower or shape which it doth latch
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Of his quick objects hath the mind no part
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor his own vision holds what it doth catch
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: For if it see the rud or gentlest sight
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The most sweet favour or deformed creature
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The mountain or the sea the day or night
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The crow or dove it shapes them to your feature
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Incapable of more replete with you
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: My most true mind thus maketh mine untrue
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
